In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here is the function `wrap_string` in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(s, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(s, " ")  # Split string into array of words
    lines = String[]  # Array to hold resultant lines
    current_line = ""  # Current line being built

    for word in words
        if length(current_line * " $word") > text_width
            push!(lines, current_line)  # Add the current line to the result
            current_line = ""  # Reset the current line
        end
        current_line *= "$word "  # Add the word to the current line
    end

    if !isempty(current_line)  # If there's still text left, add it as a new line
        push!(lines, current_line)
    end

    return join(lines, "\n")  # Join all lines with newline character and return
end
```

Example:

```julia
println(wrap_string("This is a test string. It will be wrapped to fit within the specified width.", 20))
```

The output of this example would be:

```
This is a test string.
It will be wrapped to fit within the
specified width.
```
